com.nimsoft.nimbus
Class NimAlarm

java.lang.Object
  com.nimsoft.nimbus.NimObjectSender
      com.nimsoft.nimbus.NimAlarm

public class NimAlarm
extends NimObjectSender

An alarm object with content.

Snippet 

 .....
      // Send one alarm warning 
      NimAlarm alarm = new NimAlarm(NimAlarm.NIML_WARNING, "Disk 80% full");  // So far only a warning
      String id = alarm.send();
 
 ....
 
      // Send the alarm(s) and close (optional)
      // Use NimAlarm.close() for a polite socket close (sends the "_close" 
      // command to the server).
      NimAlarm alarm = new NimAlarm(NimAlarm.NIML_MAJOR, "Disk 90% full"); // A  major error
      String id = alarm.send();                                // Send the alarm
      alarm.setSeverity(NimAlarm.NIML_MAJOR);                  // Up to a critical error
      alarm.setMessage("Disk 100% full");                      // with a new texst
      id = alarm.send();                                       // Send the updated critical alarm
      alarm.close();                                           // Disconnect (polite closedown)

NimAlarm objects are not thread-safe.

Field Detail

NIML_CLEAR

public static final int NIML_CLEAR
Severity indicating that the status is clear. This severity is used to indicate that a component has returned to a normal state.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

NIML_INFORMATION

public static final int NIML_INFORMATION
Severity indicating an informational alarm. This severity is used to indicate that an interesting event has occurred (an event that does not necessarily require action).

See Also:
Constant Field Values

public static final int NIML_WARNING
Severity indicating a warning alarm.

NimAlarm

public NimAlarm(int severity,
                String message,
                String subsystem,
                String suppressionId,
                String source,
                ConfigurationItem ci,
                String metricId)
         throws NimException
TNT2 NimAlarm constructor.

Parameters:
severity - alarm severity (NIML_CLEAR through NIML_CRITICAL)
message - alarm message (arbitrary message to display)
subsystem - subsystem identifier string (e.g. "1.1.2")
suppressionId - a unique identifier for this particular alarm, mainly used to count alarms and for the "clear" alarm
ci - the ConfigurationItem associated with this alarm
metricId - the metric identifier associated with this alarm (e.g. "2" in the full metric identifier "1.1.1:2")
Throws:
NimException

getVariables

public PDS getVariables()
Return the variable substitution PDS to be used for localization. This PDS should contain keys (variables like "$disk") and corresponding simple values (not tables or nested PDS structures) to be used to construct a localized message.

Returns:
the variable substitution PDS

getDevId

public String getDevId()
                throws NimException
Return the device identifier for the device that is associated with this alarm. The device identifier is an md5 hash that uniquely identifies the device being monitored.

Returns:
the device identifier
Throws:
NimException

getMetId

public String getMetId()
                throws NimException
Return the metric identifier for the particular metric that is associated with this alarm. The metric identifier is an md5 hash that uniquely identifies the combination of configuration item, device, and particular measurement.

Returns:
the metric identifier
Throws:
NimException

setDevId

public void setDevId(String devId)
Set the device identifier for this alarm. This method is provided for special situations in which the component sending the message is not the same component that created the original ConfigurationItem and Metric. Using the constructors with Configuration Item and metric ID are preferred, since these will also create the corresponding objects in the database.

Parameters:
devId - the device ID

setMetId

public void setMetId(String metId)
Set the metric identifier for this QoS measurement. This method is provided for special situations in which the component sending the message is not the same component that created the original ConfigurationItem and Metric. Using the constructors with Configuration Item and metric ID are preferred, since these will also create the corresponding objects in the database.

Parameters:
metId - the metric ID
